reviews.text: My family and I (2 adults and 2 young kids) just spent the night there after attending a sporting event in NYC. It was perfect for us. We had a room with two double beds. The room was nice, very clean and quiet. Considering the price...the Lucerne is great!
reviews.title: great fit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently spent three nights at the Lucerne. From the outset, the staff were consistently efficient, very helpful and extremely pleasant. Friendly in a non-obsequious way.
reviews.title: Great service at the Lucerne

reviews.text: The room was smallish, yet clean and extremely quiet for a hotel of this size and in a city as noisy as New York.
reviews.title: A big hotel with small hotel charm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are looking for the upper West side, the Lucerne is a good choice.
reviews.title: Good location, small rooms & just ok service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I did extensive research before booking the Lucerne, and I don't think I could have made a better choice. The location is great--a quick walk to Central Park, less than a block from the subway line, close proximity to two bagel stores and Zabar's, and the ambience of a European hotel with the amenities of a chain.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel--some details off

likes.liked: — Location, lay out of the room
likes.disliked: — Movie channel in living room not functioning, never got fixed during our stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a great hotel on the Upper West Side, and excellent value for money. It's within easy reach of the main attractions as there's a metro stop a block away, and Central Park and the Museum of Natural History are just a couple of blocks away. The Hotel is clean and beautifully furnished, we stayed in the smallest/cheapest grade of room (queen) and it was still a very reasonable size for a city. I couldn't fault anything about this hotel, and I would highly recommend staying here on a trip to NYC!
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel on the Upper West Side

reviews.text: I just came back from a 5 day stay from NYC and I must say that all the positive reviews about the Lucerne are absolutely correct! The front desk staff are very polite and efficient at their job. They answered our questions about travelling around the city very quickly and had great recommendations for diners and restaurants nearby.
reviews.title: Lucerne is a MUST STAY

likes.disliked: — I don't think the elevator doors could accommodate the size of a wheelchair since they're very narrow.

reviews.title: I enjoyed it alot felt european
reviews.text: Knowing that Manhattan hotel rooms can be on the smallish side I was happily surprised with the size of the Queen superior room. The whole room was tidy and the bathroom was super clean. The room even has an umbrella that you can borrow (just don't lose it or you'll have to pay $25). The only minor negative things about the room is the noise of the air conditioner and the bright light of the clock on the night stand (which I covered with a magazine).

The location is also fantastic because it's away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square, close to the subway (1 block west is 79th station on the red line), Central Park and numerous affordable and name brand shops, grocery stores (Fairways, Zabars) and restaurants (Ruby Foo's, Beard Papa, Manhattan Diner). As well I felt quite safe walking back to the hotel late at night.
reviews.title: Solid choice

reviews.text: From now on I'll definitely stay at the Lucerne every time I go to NYC!
reviews.title: We Loved the Lucerne!

reviews.text: Second time at Lucerne, tho it's been at least five years since first visit. Happy to note that terrific service I remembered is still the way of the hotel. I love upper west side and hotel's location is great. Rooms are ample by NYC standards. For this visit, stayed in 11th floor room with two double beds and in a suite on 9th floor. Rates are incredibly expensive for the modest level of luxury, but that's the way of the city. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The furnishings are nothing special but do the job. Hotel is in a safe and quiet neighborhood. Shocked to order coffee for two via room service and only be charged $5.50. What a surprise not to be ripped off. The staff is wonderful--from front desk to bellmen. We were able to get help with our bags when we changed rooms mid stay and when we checked out. Hotel also gave us a late check out and kept our bags stashed while we shopped before heading to airport. The Lucerne is proof that good service can enhance an experience tremendously--if it weren't for the staff, I'd give hotel 3 stars.
reviews.title: Terrific neighborhood and staff
Not nice! Paid higher rate than quoted.
reviews.text: Was attending a group meeting at Columbia University.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself is great-location, accomodations, etc.
reviews.title: Great location & staff

likes.disliked: — A bigger bed would have been nice!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The problem was the management staff-When I was charged the wrong rate ($100 higher per night than quoted) the manager refused to adjust my rate to the group price I had booked. They wouldn't fix my bill, in fact, the billed me twice. It took months to fix this problem. Even though the rest of the staff (doorman, etc) were very helpful and nice, the administrative problems out weigh the good things.
reviews.title: Took my wedding guests' money and charged me also

reviews.text: We stayed at the Lucerne for 5 nights at the end of September whilst in NY for our friends wedding. Having just read the last 2 reviews, our experience could not have been more different!
reviews.title: So disappointing!

reviews.text: Just returned from a 2 night stay at the Lucerne. If you go with a reasonable expectation (i.e. it is easy to spend a bundle and stay in a slum when it comes to NY), you should not be disappointed. Our room was relatively spacious, clean, and very comfortable. The staff was attentive and courteous. I was there on Mother's Day, and was pleasantly surprised by the reception they had downstairs (champagne and strawberrries, oh yes!) The location is nice too--we were a short walk from Central Park, and close enough to subway stops for this to be convenient. We would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Loved it

likes.liked: — Very welcoming feel when you walk in the lobby.

reviews.text: My friend and I just spent 2 nights at the Lucerne, a girlfriend's get-away celebrating her upcoming 60th birthday. Our room was lovely, very comfortable, extra pillows and was QUIET (we were on the 9th fl., and didn't hear any noises). The staff was very nice, helpful, polite. The location is great, just a few blocks from Central Park, a pharmacy across the street, etc., nice neighborhood feel. I would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Loved the Lucerne

reviews.text: I stayed there 3 nights in a Q/Q suite on the 3rd floor. The room was very quiet - faced the back, with view of brick wall. The beds and sheets were very comfortable. The shower was great, with HOT water and a thick terry robe. The rooms were good sized by NY hotel standards. The suite had a microwave, small fridge and coffee maker - all clean with appropriate amenities.
reviews.title: Not perfect, but I'd stay there again

reviews.text: The location is excellent. Lots of shops and restaurants within walking distance, including Filene's Basement on the block and H&H bagels one block away. The staff was very friendly and helpful and the front desk printed out my boarding pass.
reviews.title: Great time in NY, Lucerne Wonderful

reviews.text: A few negative points - turn-down service never arrived on day 2; sections of the (free) NY Times were missing on day 3; the sitting room could use a larger table for eating or working; beware the airport van service the concierge recommends (I had a cursing driver and a decrepit van, my friend's van almost was t-boned when her driver ran a red light).
reviews.title: Great Get-Away at the Lucerne

reviews.text: Stayed for four days in August with our two girls, age 6 and 9. Room was cramped but reading reviews should have asked for a larger room. Very clean, quiet and nicely updated, we would definitely stay again both for the hotel, the exceptionally friendly staff and the neighbourhood. We usually stay at the Michaelangelo without kids (fabulous hotel if you can get a good rate) near Times Square but really fell in love with this location. Went for runs in Central park, had breakfast at nearby diners for very reasonable prices.
reviews.title: quiet and clean
Very nice, away from midtown tourist lunacy
reviews.text: I would stay again but maybe book a larger room than the one we had with 2 double beds.
I've stayed at the Lucerne 5 times in the last 4 years. ..and it just gets better.
reviews.title: Location can't be beat

reviews.text: First, the location on the Upper Westside is so much nicer than the Midtown regular tourist haunts. It's unfathomable why anyone would choose to stay in the Midtown theater district. The hotel is only a few blocks from Central Park, a few blocks the other way from the Hudson River, a nice walk to Lincoln Center - and around the corner from Zabar's and H&H Bagel!!!
reviews.title: Loved the Lucerne - Great for Families!

likes.liked: — location - peaceful, uncrowded, residential neighborhood on the Upper West Side

reviews.text: The rooms are all very nice - BUT they do vary considerably in size. The first time I stayed (with my wife and 2 sons), the room was pretty cramped. Last month (July 2007) the room on a higher floor was huge - by NYC standards.
reviews.title: Highly Recommend the Lucerne

reviews.text: The hotel really lives up to the description on it's own website. Located in Upper West Side it is 5 minutes from the Museum of Natural History in one direction and 5 minutes from Riverside Park in the other.
reviews.title: New York Hotel Highlight

likes.liked: — The understated elegance of a NY Brownstone building.

reviews.text: The Nice Matin restuarant is fantastic and busy with well heeled locals and guests alike. The whole area has plenty of good restuarants though more for adults and older children than little ones.
reviews.title: Lucerne was okay

reviews.text: Whilst seemingly out of the madness of NYC it is easily accessible by Subway (end of the street - 10 mins to Times Square), by Bus (outside the door - 15 mins to 5th Avenue) and of course by Yellow Cab. This is a real blessing in that you can get peace and quiet late at night and can step out on to a clear sidewalk rather than the madness of some hotels around the tourist spots.
reviews.title: Great place at a reasonable price close to subway

reviews.text: As for New York - fantastic!! If you want a real view go to the top of the Rockefeller - half the price/queuesof the Empire State and twice the view. If you want an emotional experience go to the WTC 9/11 Tribute Centre - I defy you not to have a tear in your eye whilst your there.
reviews.title: Great Hotel for a Great Price

likes.disliked: — Rooms a little small but adequate

reviews.text: Just got back from a weeks stay at the Lucerne. Everyone from the doorman to the front desk was very nice. I had booked a double queen suite and asked for a quiet room on arrival. Was given a room on the 3rd floor in the back- no view but very quiet- until Monday when we found that several of the rooms next to ours were being renovated- as in gutted. Electric saws and hammering and the smell of paint. Now the front desk did offer to move us but since it meant repacking everything( I had unpacked everything since it was so quiet on Sun.) we decided to stay put. . We were usually out of the room during the day and the work stopped at 5pm. Just wish we had been informed before hand that there was construction.
reviews.title: Perfect Choice

reviews.text: The huge room was a pleasant surprise - double the size of most NYC rooms that are more like closets! Very comfortable also - new furnishings, drapes and carpets and a large flat screen tv. Staff was friendly and helpful. Totally recommend this little gem.
reviews.title: Wonderful large rooms!

reviews.text: I ended up staying at the Lucerne because the Excelsior was booked solid. My room at the Lucerne was clean, quiet,and roomy. The bathroom tiny. The staff friendly. The hotel's location was pretty good. If you are looking for a budget hotel on the UWS the Lucerne is for you. For the same price I'll be by the park at the Excelsior.
reviews.title: Lucerne a solid 2 1/2 star hotel

reviews.text: We had a wonderful experience at the Lucerne. The hotel is lovely, comfortable and clean. The staff were friendly and helpful, and the location can't be beat. We've found our new favorite place to stay in NYC! It is within minutes of Central Park, the Museum of Natural History tons of shops and wonderful restaurants. Our room was also the largest we've ever had in Manhattan, at a very reasonable rate. Kudos to The Lucerne!
reviews.title: Fantastic!!

likes.liked: — Everything was great...but the location was fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was born in NYC and I have high standards for my hotel stays. So when I booked a room at the Hotel Lucerne, I had high expectations. I booked at the Lucerne because of its location just west of Central Park (and a straight shot across the Park to the Metropolitan Museum) and because the price was decent for Manhattan.
reviews.title: Great little hotel on West 79th

likes.liked: — Good location, free wi-fi, nice staff, decent price
likes.disliked: — Could be a bit larger and cleaner

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, my wife and I really enjoyed our stay at the Lucerne. We stayed on the 8th floor; the photos that accompany this review show our west-facing view and the front of the hotel. The bellhops, front desk crew, and concierge are all efficient and friendly...for New York, anyway. I appreciated their efficiency when we arrived in a private car from Long Island; the bellhop took our luggage and silently waited as we checked in. Nice.
reviews.title: Very good hotel

reviews.text: We just returned from a 3 night stay at the Lucerne and it was absolutely perfect. The staff is very friendly and helpful, the hotel is beautiful, and the location is excellent. There is a subway stop just one block away, and many destinations, restaurants, shops and Central Park are within an easy walking distance. The hotel is located in a very safe, family-friendly neighborhood. I shared a one room double with my daughter, and the room was really nice, clean, quiet and comfortable. We were thrilled with our decision to stay there and will most definitely return!
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel!

reviews.text: We spent 4 nights at the Lucerne, our first ever stay in new York. We had a suite, giving us a small sitting room, which was great, and well worth the extra expense (2 parents, 2 teenage daughters). It was really clean and comfortable, but the best thing was the location, just 3 blocks from Central Park and the tour bus pick-up outside the Natural History Museum. It was also near a subway station, with just a few stops to Times Square. The breakfasts (15% off at the attached restaurant) were lovely, and offered a good variety, ranging from fruit to the New York Heartattack! When we needed a taxi, the doormen were great at finding one, and it was very reasonable. On a wider front, we loved New York, and were amazed at how clean everywhere was, and how friendly everyone was. Oh, and recommend the Chicago Uno Grill, near the Museum, for meals.
reviews.title: great location

reviews.text: Our family of 4 with 2 children ages 5 and 8 stayed at the Lucerne in August for 2 nights. We usually go to NYC every 1-2 years for vacation and we have always stayed at this hotel. This was our 4th visit. The room had been recently renovated. Service was excellent. The location is great for our itinerary since we walked to everything - the American Museum of Natural History, Central Park and Central Park Zoo, Metropolitan Museum of Art, Children's Musuem of Manhattan, and Times Square. We go to H and H Bagels, Zabar's, Patsy's, and Celeste all of which are within a 5 to 10 minutes walk. We almost didn't book the hotel due to the cost but we were able to get a reasonable rate since it was August. We are now spoiled and my husband doesn't want to stay anywhere else! PS For those of you with kids there is a Wild West themed playground for kids about 2-3 blocks south on Amsterdam.
reviews.title: A wonderful experience - again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Two of us stayed a week and enjoyed the hotel immensely. We had spent a fair amount of time reading reviews and learning about NYC before selecting the Lucerne for: (1) suite with the kitchenette (so we could spend all day out without having to go hunting for a restaurant every evening), (2) location - residential not touristy, near subway, bus, Central Park, museum mile, Zabar's deli. A bonus was to discover that the Upper West Side has become more fashionable lately and there are lots of lively restaurants/bars on Amsterdam, right round the corner. The a/c was fine and it was a bonus to be able to open room windows. There was very little traffic noise on 12th floor. The toilet did block twice but they cleared it promptly.
reviews.title: Recommend this hotel - great location and good rooms

likes.disliked: — small kitchenette - awkward to work in; no table for eating

reviews.text: Zabar's deli on 80th and Broadway is a delight. You can buy very good quality food here (for self-preparation as well as made dishes) - enough for your stay. But there's also plenty of nearby places for all meal types. We went mainly for the art galleries - the Met Museum is very good value - we spent two days there; MoMA is also very good but the Guggenheim is over-rated for its content.
reviews.title: Great stay!
